meanings.definition: The force exerted on a surface by the weight of the air above it.
meanings.sent1: The preassure of the air on the balloon made it float.
meanings.sent2: The preassure in the tire kept it inflated.
meanings.sent3: The preassure from the wind made the kite soar high in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The preassure of expectations weighed heavily on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The preassure of the water crushed the submarine as it dove deeper.

meanings.definition: The feeling of stress or urgency caused by a demanding situation.
meanings.sent1: She felt the preassure of the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent2: The preassure of deadlines at work can be overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The preassure of getting a perfect score made him study all night.
meanings.sent4: The preassure of public speaking can be nerve-wracking.
meanings.sent5: The preassure of the race caused her heart to race with anxiety.

meanings.definition: To persuade or urge someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: He tried to preassure his friend to join the team.
meanings.sent2: She preassured him to attend the party with her.
meanings.sent3: The kids preassured their parents to get a puppy.
meanings.sent4: The salesman preassured the customer to buy the latest model.
meanings.sent5: The coach preassured the team to give their best performance.
